result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis A. Dettmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Travis A. Dettmann is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Travis A. Dettmann was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:03 a.m. Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court, in custody, with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CF58. Schiek speaks to agreement/resolution. In 15CF58, State moves to amend to possession of heroin, s. 961.41(3g)(am), Class I felony. In 15CF177, State moves to dismiss Ct. 1. Court grants State's motion to amend Ct. 1 in 15CF58 and dismiss Ct. 1 in 15CF177. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CF58 and Ct. 2 in 15CF177. Schiek statement to sentencing--victim impact compliance. Voorhees statement to sentencing. Court statement to sentencing--informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Court sentencing
15CF58
WHS
2 yrs. POP
CC/CV/DNA surcharge/Supervision fees
Appeal rights given

15CF177
120 days' county jail w/Huber
21 days' credit
CC - collected by DOC 
DNA sample
Appeal rights given

2:45 p.m. Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court, via video, with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:49 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:45 am.
No contact with NIcholas Owens except for work purposes.

01:20 p.m. Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel - John Vorhees represents on underlying case - directed to contact PD's office,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $  sig bond. Intra circuit to Branch II.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
